summary: This bill, the Protecting America’s Treasures by Raising Inflow from Overseas Tourists (PATRIOT) Parks Act, amends the Federal Lands Recreation Enhancement Act. It authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to collect a surcharge from international visitors entering National Park System units. The surcharge amount is set by the superintendent of each park, with the goal of maximizing revenue while maintaining visitation. Proceeds from the surcharge go back to the applicable park units.  The bill also introduces a surcharge on the National Parks and Federal Recreational Lands Pass for international visitors.
